snippet: The National Transportation Safety Board released thousands of documents related to its 2014 investigation of the blast, which left eight people dead.
abstract: National Transportation Safety Board releases documents revealing that federal inquiry into deadly 2014 East Harlem gas explosion focused on plastic pipes installed by Consolidated Edison in years before blast; tests revealed that new pipe installed beneath area in which two buildings were leveled is susceptible to leakage; panel's conclusions are expected within few months.
lead_paragraph: The National Transportation Safety Board released thousands of documents related to its 2014 investigation of the blast, which left eight people dead.

headline.main: Inquiry Into Deadly East Harlem Explosion Focuses on Con Ed’s Plastic Pipes
headline.print_headline: Inquiry Into East Harlem Explosion Focuses on Con Ed’s Plastic Pipes
